text: Ben Lane (born 13 July 1997) is a badminton player from England and a former national champion in doubles. ==Biography== He started playing badminton at aged nine, and in his junior career, he had won the U-17 European Championships in the boys' and mixed doubles event in 2014. Lane also won two silvers and a bronze medal at the 2015 European Junior Championships. Lane was part of the English team that won the mixed team bronze at the 2018 Commonwealth Games in Gold Coast. Lane was educated at Exmouth Community College. ==Family== His mother Suzanne Louis-Lane, represented England in badminton and had won the women's singles title at the National Championships in 1993 and 1994. His older brother, Alex, represented England in badminton and won the men's singles at the 2017 National Championships. == Achievements == === European Junior Championships === Boys' doubles {| class="sortable wikitable" style="font-size: 90%;" !
